greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Irregular triangle read by rows where row n gives the differences between consecutive divisors of n in weakly decreasing order.
example: For example, the divisors of 18 are {1,2,3,6,9,18}, with differences {1,1,3,3,9}, so row 18 is {9,3,3,1,1}.
xref: Same as A193829 with rows sorted in weakly decreasing order.
Same as A328027 with rows reversed.
Heinz numbers of rows are A328023.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Oct 02 2019
